system.description:
Target: A section of the chosen element no larger than a 5-foot cube 

When you cast this spell, choose one of the four classical elements, air, earth, fire, or water. 

If you chose air, then choose one of the following options:

  • You can create a quick gust of wind. This is enough to blow papers around, cause wind chimes to jingle, ruffle hair, or extinguish a candle flame, but not put out a torch or larger fire or to move objects of any significant weight.

  • You can create a bubble of air in a body of liquid. The air is enough to allow a medium-sized creature to breathe for one round and persists for an hour or until used somehow (such as being inhaled by a creature), before dissipating into the surrounding liquid.

  • You can create a thin swirl of colored smoke. The smoke can be any color you wish, but does not interfere with vision or breathing.

  • You can remove or create smells in a 5’ cube of air within range.

If you chose earth, then choose one of the following options:

  • You can turn a fist-sized clump of dirt, sand, or clay into an equally-sized clump of dirt, sand, or clay.

  • You can form a cubic foot or dirt, sand, or clay into a different shape. The earth holds its shape until disturbed or until the duration expires, at which point it crumbles, unless it could hold the shape normally. (You could make a vase out of clay and it would hold its shape, but a vase made of sand would crumble.)

  • You can create up to 25 fist-shaped holes (suitable for planting seeds) in a 5’ x 5’ section of dirt, clay, or sand, creating a small pile of displaced earth near each hole. 

  • You can dry a 5’ x 5’ section of dirt or clay to the point where it hardens or soften it into mud that will leave messy footprints when walked through.

If you chose fire, then choose one of the following options:

  • You can change the color of an existing flame for an hour. This does not change the flame’s temperature or how much light it provides.

  • You can scoop a section of flame from an existing fire into your hands and deposit it on another flammable object or surface within 5 feet without burning yourself.

  • You can extinguish a fire up to the size of a normal campfire.

  • You can create colorful showers of sparks similar to a sparkler.

If you chose water, then choose one of the following options:

  • You can cause up to a 5’ cube of water you can see to flow as you direct. The water can only be moved inside the radius of the spell and does not move quickly enough to cause damage or move creatures, but can douse flames, be sprinkled over a garden, etc.

  • You can freeze the water as long as it is not occupied by any creatures. The water thaws and becomes liquid again after an hour.

  • You can change the color of the water or make it cloudy. This affects the entire mass of the water uniformly. It reverts to its original traits after an hour.

  • You can cause the water to evaporate, creating a thin fog that does not obscure vision and a feeling of humidity.
